EagleLock* EagleSynchronizer_CreateLock ( void   ) 

Create a new EagleLock.

Locks can be used to synchronize block of code over multiple threads.

See also:
EagleSynchronizer_Lock()
EagleSynchronizer_Unlock()

00014     EagleLock *lock = (EagleLock*) malloc(sizeof(EagleLock));

00016     return lock;

void EagleSynchronizer_Lock ( EagleLock *  lock  ) 

Lock an EagleLock.

Only one thread may hold a lock at any given time so other threads trying to get access to this lock will wait until it is unlocked.

Parameters:
lock The lock initialized with EagleSynchronizer_CreateLock()
See also:
EagleSynchronizer_Unlock()

Definition at line 29 of file EagleSynchronizer.c.

00030 {
00031     pthread_mutex_lock(&lock->mutex);
00032 }

void EagleSynchronizer_Unlock ( EagleLock *  lock  ) 

Unlock an EagleLock.

Only one thread may hold a lock at any given time so the next thread waiting for this lock will be able to continue.

Parameters:
lock The lock initialized with EagleSynchronizer_CreateLock()
See also:
EagleSynchronizer_Lock()

00045     pthread_mutex_unlock(&lock->mutex);
